2.title: Bank of America Stock Tumbles Amid Mixed Signals
2.snippet: Bank of America ( ($BAC) ) has fallen by -8.55%. Read on to learn why. Bank of America experienced a notable decline in its stock price over the past week,
2.content:
Bank of America ( (BAC) ) has fallen by -8.55%. Read on to learn why.

Bank of America experienced a notable decline in its stock price over the past week, dropping by 8.55%. This movement comes amidst mixed analyst actions and market reactions. Erste Group analyst Hans Engel downgraded the stock from Buy to Hold, contributing to the negative sentiment around the stock. Such downgrades often signal caution to investors, potentially leading to sell-offs and impacting the stock’s performance.

On the flip side, Baird upgraded Bank of America to Outperform from Neutral, raising its price target from $45 to $50. Baird’s analysis suggests that the recent weakness in the bank’s shares presents a buying opportunity, as the risk/reward profile has improved. Despite the current volatility, Baird views Bank of America as a strong franchise available at a reasonable price, indicating potential for future gains.

Additionally, the dismissal of a lawsuit by the CFPB against Bank of America and other financial institutions could have influenced investor sentiment. This legal development might alleviate some concerns regarding regulatory risks, although it was not enough to counteract the overall downward pressure on the stock. As the market continues to digest these mixed signals, investors remain cautious about the bank’s near-term prospects.

3.title: Bank of America Warns Social Security Numbers, IDs and Other Sensitive Customer Data Potentially Exposed in Third-Party Document Destruction Blunder
3.snippet: Bank of America is warning a small group of customers about a new data breach that could potentially expose confidential and sensitive information.
3.content:
Bank of America is warning a small group of customers about a new data breach that could potentially expose confidential and sensitive information.

In a filing with the Massachusetts state government, the bank says a provider of document destruction services inappropriately handled confidential documents belonging to customers on December 30th.

The bank has not declared how many accounts are affected nationwide, noting only that at least two customers in the state are affected.

“A document destruction vendor did not secure bank-related materials appropriately in transport. Some documents were found outside of the secure containers on the exterior of the financial center.

The vendor cannot confirm if your documents were directly involved or affected. They may have been, and as a result, we are reaching out to notify you in an abundance of caution and support.”

Bank of America says the impacted information may have included first and last names, financial account details, addresses, property addresses, phone numbers, email addresses, gender, dates of birth, social security numbers and other unique government ID data.

This breach follows a separate incident revealed in January, when BofA warned another third-party breach placed the data of at least 414 customers at risk.

Following this latest incident, Bank of America says it is offering the potentially impacted customers complimentary membership to an identity-theft protection service for two years.

5.title: Chase vs. Bank of America Credit Cards – Which Is Best? [2025]
5.snippet: Generally, Chase offers better credit cards for travel rewards, while Bank of America focuses more on cash-back. However, both banks have great credit cards.
5.content:
Key Takeaways Chase offers strong travel credit cards, such as the Chase Sapphire Preferred ® Card, that earn valuable Chase Ultimate Rewards points.

Card, that earn valuable Chase Ultimate Rewards points. Bank of America offers strong credit cards for cash-back, such as the Bank of America ® Premium Rewards ® Credit Card.

Premium Rewards Credit Card. Consider switching to Chase if you are looking for reward travel, but if you have large deposits with Bank of America and prefer cash-back, Bank of America has the advantage.

Comparing what the largest banks in the U.S. offer in the way of credit cards is always fascinating. Although JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America are the 2 largest banks in the U.S. by total assets, the 2 institutions couldn’t have a more opposite approach to credit card portfolios.

In general, Bank of America focuses on cash-back rewards, while Chase is focused on those interested in travel rewards.

Sure, Bank of America and Chase both offer products that intertwine themselves with different credit card strategies, but their messaging of flagship credit cards is pretty clear in general.

Let’s compare what credit cards these 2 juggernauts offer in a head-to-head comparison!

Comparing Chase Ultimate Rewards and Bank of America Preferred Rewards

Singapore Airways Airbus A380 First Class Suites. Image Credit: Greg Stone

Chase’s flagship rewards system is called Ultimate Rewards. Even though Chase works with airlines and hotels, including United and IHG, to issue co-branded credit cards, Ultimate Rewards is unique because it isn’t tied to a single airline or hotel.

For this reason, Chase Ultimate Rewards points are incredibly valuable and easy to use. Best of all, Chase issues a series of different credit cards that earn Ultimate Rewards points (or cards with rewards easily converted into Ultimate Rewards points).

Bank of America’s flagship rewards program is called Preferred Rewards (its business rewards program is called Preferred Rewards for Business).

Broadly speaking, Bank of America points can’t be transferred to travel partners, which is already a huge setback for Bank of America if you’re looking to maximize value.

Right now, Chase Ultimate Rewards points can be used for:

Transfers to travel partners, including airlines and hotels

Bookings made through the Chase Travel portal

Pay Yourself Back

Gift cards

Cash-back/statement credits

Online shopping, including Apple and Amazon.com

The redemption options above are sorted from highest to lowest value. The best value, without a doubt, is to transfer Ultimate Rewards points to travel partners for luxury award travel where you can get up to 10 cents per point of value!

Right now, Chase has a fantastic list of transfer partners:

Airline Transfer Partners

Chase Transfer Partners

SCROLL FOR MORE Chase Hotel Partner Miniumum Transfer Transfer Ratio

(Chase > Hotel) Transfer Time IHG One Rewards 1,000 1:1 1 day Marriott Bonvoy 1,000 1:1 2 days World of Hyatt 1,000 1:1 Almost Instant

In particular, you can transfer Chase points to frequent flyer programs including Air Canada Aeroplan, British Airways Executive Club, United MileagePlus, Emirates Skywards, and Singapore Airlines KrisFlyer at a 1:1 ratio to book amazing flights like Emirates first class, Etihad first class, Qatar Airways Qsuites, Singapore Airlines First Class Suites, and so much more.

Even more impressive, you can transfer Chase points to World of Hyatt at a 1:1 ratio to book some amazing luxury hotel stays.

That’s why we value Chase Ultimate Rewards points at 2 cents each.

Chase travel portal reservations and Pay Yourself Back redemptions will get a maximum of 1.5 cents per point in value, while gift cards net up to 1.2 cents per point, cash-back gets 1 cent per point, and online shopping will almost always get you less than 1 cent per point of value.

On the flip-side, Bank of America points are worth a flat 1 cent per point.

However, you can earn a bonus of up to 75% extra rewards if you hold minimum deposits and/or assets in your qualifying Bank of America and/or Merrill accounts. Your points will still be worth a flat 1 cent per point, but you’ll get more rewards per dollar spent with the Preferred Rewards program.

Currently, you can use your points for gift cards, Bank of America Travel Center bookings, statement credits, or direct deposits into Bank of America and eligible Merrill investment accounts only.

Best Overall Travel Rewards Card

Image Credit: Holly Mandarich via Unsplash

If you’re looking for a great starter rewards credit card to dip your toes into travel rewards, we’ll show you our favorite picks in this section.

Winner: Chase Sapphire Preferred® Card

BEST BEGINNER CARD Chase Sapphire Preferred® Card U.P. Rating The rating for this card has been determined by our own industry experts who know the ins and outs of credit card products. Bonuses, rewards as well as rates and fees are all taken into account. Compensation from the issuer does not affect our rating. We only recommend products we either use ourselves or endorse. A fantastic travel card with a great welcome offer, good benefits, and perks for a moderate annual fee. Apply Now (at Chase's secure site) Chase Sapphire Preferred® Card A fantastic travel card with a great welcome offer, good benefits, and perks for a moderate annual fee. Welcome Offer Earn 60,000 bonus points after you spend $4,000 on purchases in the first 3 months from account opening. 60,000 bonus points UP's Offer Valuation*: $1,200 Annual Fee $95 APR 20.49% - 27.49% Variable Credit Recommended Upgraded Points credit ranges are a variation of FICO®Score 8, one of many types of credit scores lenders may use when considering your credit cardapplication. Good to Excellent (670-850) Why We Like This Card The Chase Sapphire Preferred® card is one of the best travel rewards cards on the market. Its bonus categories include travel, dining, online grocery purchases, and streaming services, which gives you the opportunity to earn lots of bonus points on these purchases. Additionally, it offers flexible point redemption options, no foreign transaction fees, and excellent travel insurance coverage including primary car rental insurance. With benefits like these, it’s easy to see why this card is an excellent choice for any traveler. Pros & Cons Pros 5x points on all travel booked via the Chase Travel portal

5x points on select Peloton purchases over $150 (through March 31, 2025)

5x points on Lyft purchases (through March 31, 2025) Cons $95 annual fee

No elite benefits like airport lounge access or hotel elite status Read Full Review Card Highlights Earn 60,000 bonus points after you spend $4,000 on purchases in the first 3 months from account opening.

Enjoy beneﬁts such as 5x on travel purchased through Chase Travel℠, 3x on dining, select streaming services and online groceries, 2x on all other travel purchases, 1x on all other purchases, $50 Annual Chase Travel Hotel Credit, plus more.

Get 25% more value when you redeem for airfare, hotels, car rentals and cruises through Chase Travel℠. For example, 60,000 points are worth $750 toward travel.

Count on Trip Cancellation/Interruption Insurance, Auto Rental Collision Damage Waiver, Lost Luggage Insurance and more.

Get complimentary access to DashPass which unlocks $0 delivery fees and lower service fees for a minimum of one year when you activate by December 31, 2027.

Member FDIC Financial Snapshot APR: 20.49% - 27.49% Variable

Foreign Transaction Fees: None Rewards Center Chase Ultimate Rewards

Without a shadow of a doubt, the Chase Sapphire Preferred card is the best overall travel rewards credit card among those in Chase and Bank of America’s portfolios.

That’s because it has a vast rewards structure, an introductory welcome offer, and attractive ongoing perks.

Here’s how you can earn up to 5x Ultimate Rewards points with the Chase Sapphire Preferred card:

Earn 5x points on travel purchased through Chase Travel

Earn 5x points on Lyft purchases through March 31, 2025

Earn 5x points on Peloton equipment and accessory purchases over $250 (through March 31, 2025)

Earn 3x points on dining, online grocery purchases, and select streaming services

Earn 2x points on other travel purchases

Earn 1x points on other purchases

To earn even more rewards, you’ll earn a 10% anniversary bonus after every cardmember anniversary year.

We value Chase points at 2.2 cents each, which means you’d earn a maximum of 10.2% on your spending.

Furthermore, the Chase Sapphire Preferred card comes with a 25% redemption bonus on travel bookings made through Chase Travel and Pay Yourself Back through select rotating categories, which would get you a redemption value of 1.25 cents per point.

The card also has a $50 annual hotel credit on bookings made through Chase Travel, as well as a complimentary DoorDash DashPass membership (activate by December 31, 2027), phenomenal travel insurance, purchase protection, extended warranty, no foreign transaction fees, and no-additional fee authorized user cards.

Runner-up: Bank of America® Premium Rewards® Credit Card

Bank of America® Premium Rewards® credit card U.P. Rating The rating for this card has been determined by our own industry experts who know the ins and outs of credit card products. Bonuses, rewards as well as rates and fees are all taken into account. Compensation from the issuer does not affect our rating. We only recommend products we either use ourselves or endorse. card Keep tabs on your credit health – Chase Credit Journey helps you monitor your credit with free access to your latest score, real-time alerts, and more Financial Snapshot APR: Start off strong with 0% Intro APR for 18 months from account opening on purchases and balance transfers. A variable APR of 20.24% – 29.24% on balance transfers and purchases after the introductory period ends.

Foreign Transaction Fees: 3% of the amount of each transaction in U.S. dollars.

The Chase Slate Edge card is our top winner in the balance transfer segment. The welcome bonus is focused less on rewards and more on debt management.

To incentivize you to build strong credit habits, you can lower your interest rate by 2% every year, and you can also get an automatic review for a higher credit limit when you pay on time and spend $500 in your first 6 months.

With the Chase Slate Edge card, you’ll have access to Chase Credit Journey to help you monitor your credit, plus contactless payments, access to Chase Offers, a 6-month complimentary DoorDash DashPass membership (starting February 1, 2025, for new enrollees), purchase protection, extended warranty, zero liability fraud protection, secondary rental car insurance, and roadside dispatch.

Runner-up: BankAmericard® Credit Card

Bank of America offers attractive balance transfer promotions with its credit cards, but our favorite is the BankAmericard, which usually offers the longest introductory balance transfer APR period.

There’s a small welcome bonus, no penalty APR, and monthly FICO Score access. You can also use contactless chip technology and overdraft protection with this card.

Final Thoughts

Bank of America and Chase both have deep credit card portfolios.

Chase generally offers better credit cards for travel rewards, and these include mainstays such as the Chase Sapphire Preferred card, Chase Sapphire Reserve card, Ink Business Preferred card, and United Explorer card.

On the other hand, Bank of America offers fantastic credit cards for cash-back, especially when used in conjunction with its acclaimed Preferred Rewards program for deposit and investment accounts. Some of these include the Bank of America Premium Rewards card, Bank of America Premier Rewards Elite card, and the Bank of America Unlimited Cash Rewards card.

We hope that you’ve found this guide useful in helping you determine the best credit cards for your situation if you’re deciding between Bank of America and Chase.

The information regarding the Bank of America® Business Advantage Customized Cash Rewards Credit Card was independently collected by Upgraded Points and not provided nor reviewed by the issuer.

6.title: U-turn at Bank of America: The Last-Minute Change Everyone Is Talking About
6.snippet: The banking business is constantly changing, especially when it comes to the stock market. Investors face both challenges and opportunities on a daily basis...
6.content:
The banking business is constantly changing, especially when it comes to the stock market. Investors face both challenges and opportunities on a daily basis. The most experienced ones know that timing is everything and acting at the right moment can make a big difference in returns.

While some firms adjust their portfolios, others see potential in what might seem like a downturn. Recently, Schrum Private Wealth Management LLC reduced its holdings in Bank of America (NYSE: BAC), drawing attention in the investor community. However, many investors have seen this move as a great opportunity.

| Bank of America, Getty Images

The Great Opportunity Bank of America Offers Investors

By investing just $1,000 in Bank of America shares, one can achieve good stability and significant growth. Given the bank's consistent performance and its ability to handle economic cycles, it is undoubtedly a great option. Especially for individual shareholders who value the potential of a long-term investment.

With rising interest rates and increased banking activity, Bank of America is well-positioned to benefit from higher interest income. Additionally, its innovations in digital banking have strengthened customer engagement, paving the way for further expansion. These factors suggest that investing now could yield benefits in the coming years.

| Bank of America, Getty Images

Why Bank of America Remains a Strong Player

Despite the recent adjustment, Bank of America remains one of the most influential players in the financial sector. The company has demonstrated resilience in the face of economic fluctuations. It has maintained a solid foundation thanks to its diversity in banking services, investment operations, and growth in digital banking.

Bank of America's shares have historically shown recovery patterns after market movements, making it an attractive option for long-term investors. Additionally, its consistent dividend payments and strong financial health reinforce its appeal to those looking to invest. Buying shares now, while prices remain accessible, could allow investors to capitalize on future increases.

| Europa Press

Investors Keeping an Eye on Bank of America

While other firms adjust their portfolios according to their strategies, individual investors should consider broader market trends. Bank of America's strong position and growth potential make it an attractive option for those looking to enter the financial sector.

With a track record of adapting to market changes and generating value for its shareholders, Bank of America remains one of the best options in the banking industry. As market fluctuations create new opportunities, investors who act now could see long-term rewards.

0.title: Bank of America Announces Redemption of CAD400,000,000 Floating Rate Senior Notes, Due March 2026
0.snippet: PRNewswire/ -- Bank of America Corporation announced today that it will redeem on March 16, 2025 all CAD400,000000 principal amount outstanding of its...
0.content:
CHARLOTTE, N.C., March 7, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Bank of America Corporation announced today that it will redeem on March 16, 2025 all CAD400,000,000 principal amount outstanding of its Floating Rate Senior Notes, due March 2026 (CUSIP No. 060505GE8, ISIN: CA060505GE87) (the "Notes"), at a redemption price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the Notes, plus accrued and unpaid interest to, but excluding, the redemption date of March 16, 2025. Since March 16, 2025 is not a business day, the redemption price of the Notes, together with accrued and unpaid interest, will be paid on the next succeeding business day, March 17, 2025. Interest on the Notes will cease to accrue on the redemption date.

Payment of the redemption price for the Notes will be made in accordance with the applicable procedures of CDS Clearing and Depository Services Inc. The Bank of New York Mellon Trust Company, N.A. is the trustee and BNY Trust Company of Canada is the paying agent for the Notes.

Bank of America

Bank of America is one of the world's leading financial institutions, serving individual consumers, small and middle-market businesses and large corporations with a full range of banking, investing, asset management and other financial and risk management products and services. The company provides unmatched convenience in the United States, serving approximately 69 million consumer and small business clients with 3,700 retail financial centers, approximately 15,000 ATMs (automated teller machines) and award-winning digital banking with approximately 58 million verified digital users. Bank of America is a global leader in wealth management, corporate and investment banking and trading across a broad range of asset classes, serving corporations, governments, institutions and individuals around the world. Bank of America offers industry-leading support to approximately 4 million small business households through a suite of innovative, easy-to-use online products and services. The company serves clients through operations across the United States, its territories and more than 35 countries. Bank of America Corporation stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: BAC).

Bank of America, Member FDIC, is among the most popular and well-known U.S. banks. There are thousands of ATMs and financial centers, so it’s typically convenient to find locations with the services you need nearby. Bank of America also offers a mobile app for convenient online banking, credit cards and debit cards.

How To Locate a Bank of America Near You

You can easily locate the nearest Bank of America branch through a Google Maps search or by visiting the Bank of America website, which has a branch locator feature. Just enter a ZIP code, an address, a city or a state to get started.

If you use the Bank of America website’s locator feature, you can filter the results by the services you require.

Bank of America ATM Near Me: How To Find the Nearest ATM

Using the Bank of America website’s branch locator feature, you can filter your search to list branch locations with ATMs. You can specify the type of ATM services you need, filtering the results to show branch offices that include:

Drive-thru ATMs

Walk-up ATMs

Cardless ATMs

ATMs that accept deposits and credit card payments

ATMs that allow cash withdrawals only — deposits not accepted

ATMs located inside the branch office

Bank of America ATMs: Features and Services Available

Bank of America ATMs have a variety of convenient features when you visit an ATM, including cardless transactions.

Here are some of the available services:

Cash deposits and withdrawals

Check deposits

Check account balances

Transfer funds

Cardless ATM access using the mobile app.

Bank of America Bank Branch Near Me

Consumer banking branches offer a wide range of services, from setting up bank accounts to applying for home and auto loans. If you are using the Bank of America website to find bank branches, you can filter your search by services offered under the Financial Center Services header. There are several other search filters provided by Bank of America, including:

Dedicated business teller

Drive-thru teller services

Express financial center

Accepts appointments

Financial solutions advisor

Home loans specialist

Notary services

Bank of America Hours and Availability

Bank of America provides a wide range of services for your banking needs.

Customer Service

If you need help or a customer service agent, you can:

Call 1-800-432-1000 or try any of the other phone numbers listed by department and topic on the bank’s website. Customer Service agents are typically available: Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. EST Saturday, 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. EST Sunday, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. EST

Schedule an appointment by signing into Bank of America Online.

Chat with an agent via Bank of America’s online banking portal. Be aware that this feature is only available for certain topics.

On Twitter, tweet Customer Service at the handle @BofA_Help or send a message to the bank’s Facebook page.

Hours of Operation

You can view Bank of America’s hours of operation by branch using Google Maps and clicking on each branch location. You can also access hours of operation by branch office through the Bank of America website, specifically by using the branch locator feature. It allows you to filter results by currently open, open Saturdays and open Sundays.

Bank of America Branch Services: What You Can Do In Person

If you’re looking for additional help from a banker teller, need expert guidance on finances or simply prefer to do your banking in person, Bank of America has representatives on hand to assist you.

Some of the services you can do in person:

Deposits, withdrawals and fund transfers

Open a new checking, savings or investment account

Discuss your account with a banker

Loan and mortgage consultations

Financial planning

For consultations or financial planning services, you may need to schedule an appointment ahead of time. ONce you do have that set, however, you can receive guidance on your savings, retirement planing, investing and more.

Alternatives If There’s No Bank of America Near You

Even if there isn’t a Bank of America branch near you, you can still access your account and handle any of your financial matters conveniently. Here’s how:

Use a partner ATM: By staying within the Bank of America network of ATMs, you can avoid paying third-party fees.

By staying within the Bank of America network of ATMs, you can avoid paying third-party fees. Online and mobile banking: You can log into your account via the mobile app or online to pay bills and transfer funds. You can even use your phone to complete a mobile check deposit.

You can log into your account via the mobile app or online to pay bills and transfer funds. You can even use your phone to complete a mobile check deposit. Contact customer service: For additional support, you can reach out to customer service to address issues with your account or have your questions answered.

Bank of America Near Me FAQ Here are the answers to some of the most frequently asked questions about banking with a Bank of America near you. How do I find the nearest Bank of America branch or ATM? To find the nearest Bank of America branch or ATM, you can use the branch locator on the Bank of America website. There's also an option on your phone. You can type in your location and the results will show you the available branches or ATMs nearby. Alternatively, you could search for the bank name using the Google Maps app on your mobile device.

Does Bank of America charge fees for using non-Bank of America ATMs? Yes. Bank of America may charge $2.50 per transaction, plus any other ATM operator fees, if you're using a non-Bank of America ATM. Internationally, you may be charged $5 per transaction and a 3% foreign transaction fee, depending on the amount withdrawn.

Can I deposit cash at a Bank of America ATM? Yes, you can deposit cash at a Bank of America ATM. After inserting your debit card, select the "Deposit" option on the screen and follow the instructions. You may need to specify that it will be a cash transaction. You can access the funds relatively quickly, often on the same day or the next business day.

What services are available at Bank of America ATMs? At a Bank of America, you can deposit checks and cash. You can also transfer money between your existing accounts and check your account balances. You can also enjoy cardless ATM access using your mobile phone.

What should I do if there's no Bank of America branch nearby? You can still do many banking transactions either online or on your Bank of America mobile app. This includes paying bills, transferring money and depositing checks. If you can find an ATM within the Bank of America network, that may be your best option to use to avoid fees. Finally, if you need additional support, you can reach out to customer service.

Here are the answers to some of the most frequently asked questions about banking with a Bank of America near you.

4.title: Trump Sues Capital One After Slamming Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase Over Abrupt Bank Account Terminations
4.snippet: The Trump organization just filed a lawsuit against US banking giant Capital One, accusing the lender of unjustly terminating more than 300 of the firm's...
4.content:
The Trump organization just filed a lawsuit against US banking giant Capital One, accusing the lender of unjustly terminating more than 300 of the firm’s bank accounts.

The suit claims the closures were driven by political bias, targeting the Trump family’s conservative affiliations back in 2021.

“Plaintiffs have reason to believe that Capital One’s unilateral decision came about as a result of political and social motivations and Capital One’s unsubstantiated, “woke” beliefs that it needed to distance itself from President Trump and his conservative political views. In essence, Capital One “de-banked” Plaintiffs’ Accounts because Capital One believed that the political tide at the moment favored doing so.

In addition to the considerable financial harm that Plaintiffs and their affiliated entities suffered, Capital One’s reckless decision is part of a growing trend by financial institutions in the United States of America to cut off a consumer’s access to banking services if their political views contradict with those of the financial institution. Capital One’s conduct is but one example of a systemic, subversive industry practice that aims to coerce the public to shift and re-align their political views.”

The move comes after Trump openly slammed both Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase.

At a World Economic Forum session in January, Trump publicly criticized Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan and JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon.

He accused them of denying services to conservatives, urging them to “open your banks” to those who have allegedly been unfairly kicked out of the banking system.

Trump’s remarks touch on a broader debate over alleged discrimination in the financial sector.

This month, after meeting with Republican lawmakers, Chase’s Dimon said US banks sometimes “push people out of the system” due to vague federal anti-money laundering rules.

Dimon denied political or religious bias at Chase, instead blaming regulatory pressures that force compliance-driven account closures.

About Bank of America

Bank of America is one of the largest financial institutions in the United States, with more than $3.2 trillion in assets. It is organized into four major segments: consumer banking, global wealth and investment management, global banking, and global markets. Bank of America's consumer-facing lines of business include its network of branches and deposit-gathering operations, retail lending products, credit and debit cards, and small-business services. The company's Merrill Lynch operations provide brokerage and wealth-management services, as does its private bank. Wholesale lines of business include investment banking, corporate and commercial real estate lending, and capital markets operations. Bank of America has operations in several countries but is primarily US-focused.

Return on Assets (ROA): Bank of America's ROA is below industry standards, pointing towards difficulties in efficiently utilizing assets. With an ROA of 0.19%, the company may encounter challenges in delivering satisfactory returns from its assets.

8.title: Baird upgrades Bank of America as this week's sell-off is a buying opportunity
8.snippet: The recent pullback in Bank of America is an opportunity for investors to buy the stock, according to Baird.
8.content: The recent pullback in Bank of America is an opportunity for investors to buy the stock, according to Baird. Analyst David George upgraded shares to outperform from neutral. He also notched his price target $5 higher to $50, implying shares could rise around 20.6% from Thursday's close. According to George, Bank of America is a "great franchise at [a] reasonable price." The analyst cited Bank of America's "best-in-class deposit franchise, consistent execution, relatively low credit risk, and top-tier markets businesses." Thanks to the stock's 10.6% sell-off this week, he believes shares are now trading at a more reasonable valuation. Bank of America and other big banking peers have tumbled this week amid a broader market pullback, due to concerns of weaker U.S. economic growth and global transactional activity stemming from tariffs. "BofA is under-earning currently given its below-normal [net interest margin], which should provide a nice tailwind over the coming years, and BAC is well-positioned to return capital given its healthy PPNR profitability and modest balance sheet growth," George added. BAC 5D mountain BAC in past 5 trading days Most analysts are bullish on the stock, per LSEG. Of the 24 who cover it, 19 have a buy or strong buy rating. In addition to Bank of America, George also raised his rating on JPMorgan Chase to neutral from underperform. JPMorgan shares also slipped nearly 7% week to date. Despite JPMorgan's "best-in-class franchise" and the stock's recent decline, the analyst believes shares are still trading at too-high of a valuation. "JPM shares are off ~11% in the last month (vs. SPY -5.5%), and we are having a tough time making the short case in the name after this recent weakness. With the stock still relatively expensive at ~2.55x TBV, we aren't buyers of the stock but don't believe it makes sense to be short, as defensive-minded market participants will likely move into JPM if economic data gets a little more volatile," George noted.

9.title: Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) Lands Upgrade at Baird
9.snippet: Good news for banking giant Bank of America ($BAC), as it landed an upgrade from analysts at Baird recently. The recent movement in the stock is providing...
9.content:
Good news for banking giant Bank of America (BAC), as it landed an upgrade from analysts at Baird recently. The recent movement in the stock is providing an excellent opportunity for a buy, though investors did not seem to agree. In fact, investors sold off shares, though at a subdued pace, and sent share prices down fractionally in Friday afternoon’s trading.

David George, analyst with Baird who has five stars on TipRanks, hiked the rating on Bank of America shares from Neutral to Outperform. Further, George also boosted the price target on Bank of America shares, sending them from $45 to $50 per share, which suggests an upside potential of better than 20% against Thursday’s closing numbers.

George points out that Bank of America is still a major name in United States banking operations, as it has been for some time now, and thanks to the recent downward pressure on shares—which actually continued into today—these shares were available at “…a reasonable price.” George also called attention to Bank of America’s solid risk as a creditor, its excellent markets operations, its solid deposit business, and its overall execution as well.

Getting In On Growth

In another interesting twist, Bank of America is looking to bring in a new feature to its upcoming Consumer and Retail Conference in Miami, Florida: Camping World Holdings (CWH). As it turns out, Camping World is the world’s largest recreational vehicle (RV) dealer in the world now, and as such, it should make a good addition to Bank of America’s retail lineup.

Camping World will deliver an oddly-appropriate “fireside chat” on March 11 at 2:40 PM ET, and replays of the event will be available through Camping World’s investor pages for the following 90 days. Given that Bank of America recently upgraded Thor Industries (THO) on the strength of the RV market, having an RV dealer show up at its retail conference actually makes a certain amount of sense.

Is BAC a Good Buy Right Now?

Turning to Wall Street, analysts have a Moderate Buy consensus rating on BAC stock based on 10 Buys, five Holds, and one Sell assigned in the past three months, as indicated by the graphic below. After a 17.08% rally in its share price over the past year, the average BAC price target of $52.86 per share implies 28.83% upside potential.

See more BAC analyst ratings

1.snippet: Bank of America's customer service line is 1-800-432-1000. Team members are available Monday through Friday from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST and on weekends from 8...
1.content:
Bank of America Customer Service: How To Get the Support You Need

bombuscreative / Getty Images/iStockphoto

Commitment to Our Readers GOBankingRates' editorial team is committed to bringing you unbiased reviews and information. We use data-driven methodologies to evaluate financial products and services - our reviews and ratings are not influenced by advertisers. You can read more about our editorial guidelines and our products and services review methodology. 20 Years

Helping You Live Richer Reviewed

by Experts Trusted by

Millions of Readers

Bank of America, Member FDIC, is the second largest bank in the United States. The bank offers everyday banking, loans, investments and business accounts. With a full suite of services, customers may need access to bank representatives. Find out what you need to know about Bank of America customer service options.

Understanding Bank of America Customer Service Options

When customer support is easy to access, it helps build trust with your bank, knowing that your personal or small business finances are handled. As one of the largest banks in the nation, Bank of America provides extended customer care as part of its financial services.

Bank of America Customer Service Numbers

Knowing which Bank of America phone number to call can save you time and even money. If you have an issue with a product or service, you’ll want to get in touch a bank representative right away.

You can always go to the customer service page of the bank’s website and select the topic you need to get information on or help with. You can also contact them directly.

Here are the customer service numbers where you can reach Bank of America:

Saturday and Sunday

8 a.m. to 8 p.m. EST

Bank of America Customer Service Hours

Bank of America’s customer service line is 1-800-432-1000. Team members are available Monday through Friday from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST and on weekends from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. EST. Automated support is always available.

To find local branch hours, you can use the Bank of America locator and enter your city, state and zip code. You’ll be able to browse the list of banks that are closest to you.

Contacting Bank of America via Email and Online Chat

You can log in to your account and access “Contact Us” in the “Help and Support” menu and then choose the topic that covers your issue. If your topic isn’t listed, Bank of America recommends calling customer service. Emails are usually answered within two to four business days.

You can also access a virtual assistant named Erica 24/7 for an online chat. Live chat specialists are available as well. Log in to your account and navigate to the “Contact Us” tab. Click on “Chat Now” to start a conversation.

Visiting a Bank of America Branch for In-Person Help

To schedule an in-person appointment, you can call your local branch. Alternatively, you can log in to your account, navigate to the “Help and Support” tab and find a time that works for you. You can also schedule an appointment via your app.

These are the comprehensive services that are available in person at Bank of America:

Everyday banking: Open a new checking or savings account, deposit or withdraw cash, and manage existing accounts. You can also request cashier’s checks and money orders in person. Access to ATMs is also available.

Open a new checking or savings account, deposit or withdraw cash, and manage existing accounts. You can also request cashier’s checks and money orders in person. Access to ATMs is also available. Lending services: Inquire about home, auto and business loans.

Inquire about home, auto and business loans. Investment services: Receive guidance on retirement planning, IRAs and college planning.

Receive guidance on retirement planning, IRAs and college planning. Small business services: Open business accounts and find out about lines of credit.

Open business accounts and find out about lines of credit. Specialized services: You can get documents notarized and make night and commercial deposits.

Tips for Getting the Best Support from Bank of America

If you’re dealing with a banking issue, you want answers fast. When you call in to customer service, be sure to have your account information ready. You may also need to provide identity verification, either with an account number or a Social Security number. Have all documentation ready when you talk to the representative.

Good To Know The best time to call Bank of America is early morning on weekdays or Sundays. The customer service line opens at 8 a.m. EST on weekdays and weekends.

If you need to escalate a customer service issue, you have a few options. You can call the customer service line and request a supervisor if you don’t feel like your issue has been addressed.

The other avenue is to log in to your online banking account and navigate to the “Help and Support” tab and click on “Contact Us.” You can send a secure message regarding your issue via email.

One other option is to visit a branch in person to find out if an on-site banker can help address your problem.

Bank of America Customer Service for International Customers

If you’re traveling internationally and need to contact Bank of America, you can make a collect call and dial 1-315-724-4022. Customer service is open Monday to Friday from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST and Saturday and Sunday from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. EST.

For debit card issues overseas, you can call collect and dial 1-315-724-4022. For credit card issues while traveling internationally, you can call 1-302-738-5719. The hours are Monday to Friday from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. EST and Saturday and Sunday from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. EST.

Tips for International Travelers and Expats

If you plan to travel internationally or are an expat, these tips may come in handy:

Order foreign currency before traveling to your international destination.

Make sure you download the Bank of America mobile app before you travel.

Find an international partner ATM at your destination to avoid unnecessary fees.

Use a digital wallet. This allows you to pay without taking out your wallet or card. Typically, the digital wallet number is different from your physical card.

Bank of America Customer Service FAQ Here are some answers to frequently asked questions about Bank of America customer service and how to get in contact. Is there a 24-hour Bank of America customer service number? Bank of America's customer service number for credit card customers is available 24/7 at 800-732-9194. For banking assistance, you can call Bank of America's customer service line at 800-432-1000. Automated support is available 24/7. However, representatives are not available 24/7. Representatives are available from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. ET Monday through Friday and from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. ET Saturday and Sunday.

What time does Bank of America customer service open? Bank of America's customer service line for banking assistance is available from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. ET Monday through Friday and from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. ET Saturday and Sunday.

What is the fastest way to contact Bank of America customer service? The fastest way to speak with a customer service representative is to call 1-800-432-1000. Automated support is available 24/7, but a live representative is only available during designated hours.

How can I speak to a live representative at Bank of America? To speak directly with a live Bank of America customer service representative, you can call their customer service line at 1-800-432-1000. This line is available 24/7 for general account information and services.

Are there fees for using Bank of America customer support services? There are no fees charged for calling a Bank of America customer service representative.



More About Bank of America

Caitlyn Moorhead contributed to the reporting for this article.

2.title: Panama closes 1.2 billion-euro loan with Bank of America subsidiary
2.snippet: Panama's government has closed a 1.2 billion euros ($1.29 billion) loan with a two-year maturity with a subsidiary of Bank of America, the Economy Ministry...
2.content:
PANAMA CITY (Reuters) - Panama's government has closed a 1.2 billion euros ($1.29 billion) loan with a two-year maturity with a subsidiary of Bank of America, the Economy Ministry said a statement on Thursday.

The ministry indicated that the financing, which will be disbursed in its dollar equivalent, was authorized on Friday.

($1 = 0.9269 euros)

(Reporting by Elida Moreno; Writing by Aida Pelaez-Fernandez; Editing by Sandra Maler)

3.title: Bank of America CEO Willing to Hire in Japan as Market Revives
3.snippet: Bank of America Corp. Chief Executive Officer Brian Moynihan said he's willing to add employees in Japan as the local economy picks up after decades of...

4.title: Bank of America and BlackRock Remove DEI Terms From Reports
4.snippet: Bank of America and BlackRock removed diversity mentions from reports as Wall Street firms reassess DEI policies amid legal, political & investor pressures.
4.content:
Is Wall Street's relationship with DEI changing?

Bank of America and BlackRock have removed references to diversity from their latest annual reports, with both companies referring to it under different rubrics.

This small change speaks to a shift in how major financial institutions are approaching diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) policies in 2025.

These companies aren’t the only ones – many of the United States’ largest organisations have re-evaluated their stance on DEI since US President Donald Trump’s election in November 2024.

Google, Meta, Walmart and McDonald’s are just a few of the companies to have scaled back DEI commitments since President Trump took office for a second time in January 2025.

President Trump has been expressive in his criticism of corporate DEI policies, with conservative activist groups like the National Center for Public Policy Research (NCPPR) also challenging businesses to roll back on DEI.

5.title: Bank of America CEO willing to hire in Japan amid revival
5.snippet: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan said he's willing to add employees in Japan as the local economy picks up after decades of deflation.
5.content:
Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan said he’s willing to add employees in Japan as the local economy picks up after decades of deflation.

The return of price and wage growth, rising interest rates and corporate reforms are spurring activity in the country, Moynihan said in an interview in Tokyo on Friday.

"We’ll hire internal people, but if there’s not enough, we’ll bring people from around the world,” he said. "It’s an exciting city to live in, Tokyo, so it’s not hard to get people to come here.”

6.title: BofA eyes personalization, speedier onboarding for business clients
6.snippet: The team behind the bank's CashPro platform is making tweaks and enhancements to bring more of the consumer experience to the digital business banking space...
6.content:
The team behind Bank of America’s digital banking platform for businesses is concentrating on hastening onboarding and increasing personalization to sharpen client experience.

That’s according to Kristin Gemma, head of CashPro communication, products and strategy at the bank. CashPro handles treasury and payment needs for about 40,000 companies, ranging from small businesses to global corporates.

Kristin Gemma Permission granted by Bank of America

“We’re really thinking about, how do we improve onboarding for clients, so that it doesn’t take a long time to get set up with the bank?” Gemma said during a recent interview. She manages CashPro’s communications process team, which conveys platform changes and developments to clients, and provides customers with thought leadership and information on the payments landscape.

Finance professionals, corporate treasurers, accounts payable and receivable staff and C-suite executives use CashPro to manage their treasury, trade, credit and investments. That includes making payment approvals or decisions related to fraud, or depositing checks. More than $1 trillion in payments were made through CashPro’s app last year, a 25% year-over-year jump, as businesses favor mobile capabilities.

Last year, the Charlotte, North Carolina-based lender added a function that allows CashPro users to launch an inquiry into the status of a transaction within the platform, part of the bank’s continuous effort to boost its digital banking capabilities so businesses can do more online instead of calling or emailing for assistance.

Currently, clients spend time talking to bankers or customer service employees, sharing information over the phone and via email, which the bank envisions moving to the CashPro platform, Gemma said.

“We can all get a transparent view of what’s happening, the client can feel very comfortable exchanging information with us in the platform, because they’re authenticated,” Gemma said.

To that end, the CashPro team is working to roll out more functionality “to speed up that time to onboard and also take out a lot of the noise,” Gemma said. The team has tweaked CashPro’s application programming interfaces – which allow clients to access the platform through a third party such as a treasury management system or enterprise resource planning platform – to hasten client onboarding time.

Later this year, the bank aims to add a new credit card enrollment option to the platform, Gemma said. That will allow certain business banking and commercial banking clients to apply for a commercial card through CashPro, similar to what the bank already does on the consumer side.

“It’s bringing more of that consumer experience into Cash Pro,” Gemma said. She declined to specify when the bank plans to add that capability.

CashPro continues to be an area of focus for the bank, which spends $13 billion annually on technology, as of this year; of that amount, $4 billion goes toward new technology initiatives, a bank spokesperson said. Gemma declined to share specific investment numbers for CashPro.

Bank of America also seeks to step up personalization for its CashPro clients, she said, which is likely to make it easier to draw their attention to changes or functions that might benefit them.

“Our clients are getting so much information now – we all are, right? – it can be hard to cut out the noise and understand what is truly impactful,” Gemma said. “We do certainly see that with clients, and it takes multiple tries, in some cases, to get them to take advantage of a new capability that we know will help them.”

“The more relevant we can make our communications to them, the more likely it is that they’ll actually be able to pay attention to it,” Gemma added.

Gemma’s team works to educate clients on how they can use CashPro, because some customers are eager to be early adopters and immediately try new functions, but others need to be informed answers to certain questions could be obtained faster through CashPro’s chat function, which is powered by BofA’s virtual financial assistant Erica. Erica has been able to handle about 40% of client inquiries in CashPro’s chat function, Gemma said.

The team is also doubling down on data intelligence, to give customers proactive notifications about potential actions, she said. Since a digital tool called Insights was rolled out, the bank has seen strong client adoption, “where they actually are taking steps that we recommend that they take,” she said.

Recently, for companies whose users had a payment approval that exceeded average amounts, CashPro issued a notification suggesting limits be reviewed. In response, about 1,000 users took action to lower payment approval limits, Gemma said.

“We will be doing more personalized and proactive pushes of insights like this throughout the year,” Gemma said. Leveraging data to help clients protect themselves remains a “top focus area.”

8.title: Official: Bank of America Surprises Everyone and Announces an Exciting Development
8.snippet: Bank of America is one of the largest and most popular banks in the United States. It's a great responsibility because it requires the bank to constantly...
8.content:
Bank of America is one of the largest and most popular banks in the United States. It's a great responsibility because it requires the bank to constantly improve to offer its customers the best services. Now, it has announced a new development that, more than likely, other banks will also copy.

Recently, Bank of America has announced plans to launch its own stable digital currency. This way, it joins a list of major financial institutions exploring these currencies.

According to Bank of America, this is part of an initiative to expand its digital payment options and better serve its customer base. Although specific details haven't been revealed yet, this move marks a significant shift in the bank's approach. Stable digital currencies are cryptocurrencies designed to maintain a stable value by being linked to an asset, such as the U.S. dollar.

| Bank of America, Google Maps

This makes them attractive to financial institutions because they combine the benefits of cryptocurrencies with the stability of traditional assets. Bank of America is launching its own stable currency at a time when the bank sees a growing demand for digital payment systems.

Stable Currency: A Growing Trend in the Financial Industry

The development of stable currencies is rapidly gaining ground in the global financial landscape. Prominent banks, including JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs, have already experimented with these digital assets. However, Bank of America is focusing on creating a stable currency specifically designed for institutional use.

This will allow offering new solutions to companies seeking faster and more secure ways to manage cross-border payments. The bank's foray into this financial product could revolutionize the way it approaches international transactions and digital asset management.

| Pexels, Bank of America, Google Maps, en.e-noticies.cat

As the financial industry continues to evolve, digital currencies are seen as an effective tool to simplify digital transactions. For Bank of America, they could enhance its position in the digital payments market by offering a more reliable, transparent, and scalable alternative to traditional banking systems.

What Does This Mean for the Future of Digital Payments?

Bank of America's entry into the stable currency space signals the beginning of a new chapter in digital finance. With the rise of decentralized finance (DeFi) and cryptocurrencies, traditional banks are increasingly seeking ways to offer related services. The bank's stable currencies could help provide faster transactions with lower fees.

Although details remain limited, this launch by Bank of America could serve as a catalyst for other banks to follow suit. This would lead to greater competition and innovation in the digital payments sector. The financial market, in general, will be watching closely as Bank of America rolls out this new initiative in the coming months.

Everything Else You Need To Know About Bank of America Credit Cards

Redeeming Rewards

Bank of America offers flexibility to redeem points for cash-back, gift cards, travel, or bonus cash-back when you transfer your cash into one of your Bank of America-associated accounts.

Points earned on your Bank of America rewards-earning credit card can be redeemed for 1 cent per point. In many cases, you’re earning 2 to 3 points per dollar spent on the card, so you’re receiving good value.

Hot Tip: If you have a card such as the Bank of America Business Advantage Travel card that earns 3 points per dollar on travel purchased through Bank of America Travel Center, you can purchase travel and earn 3 points per dollar and redeem points at 1 cent per point for a statement credit to cover that purchase.



Relationships Matter

Cash-back 10% bonus: If you have a bank account with Bank of America, the reward benefits that come with your Bank of America credit cards may receive a bonus. Cardholders who have a Bank of America checking or savings account, 529, or Merrill Lynch account can receive a 10% bonus when redeeming cash-back into an eligible account.

If you have a bank account with Bank of America, the reward benefits that come with your Bank of America credit cards may receive a bonus. Preferred Rewards Program: If you have $20,000 or more in qualifying Bank of America deposit accounts or Merrill Edge and Merrill Lynch investments, you may qualify for the Preferred Rewards program and receive a 25% to 75% rewards bonus on your Bank of America credit card.

Fraud detection and $0 liability for fraudulent transactions

ShopSafe service generates a temporary credit card number when shopping online

Return protection

Warranty manager service

Purchase security

Bank of America Travel Protections and Benefits

Premium Bank of America credit cards will offer additional travel protections and benefits:

Upgrades and luxury perks and benefits when redeeming rewards with the Visa Signature Luxury Hotel Collection

Concierge service

Auto rental collision damage waiver

Trip delay and reimbursement

Trip cancellation or interruption

Baggage delay protection

Lost luggage reimbursement

Roadside dispatch program

Travel and emergency assistance services

Common carrier travel accident insurance

Emergency evacuation and transportation coverage

To determine which Bank of America benefits and protections come with the Bank of America card you’re considering, you’ll need to access the specific card summary or cardholder agreement. Complete details are provided in your new account materials.

Final Thoughts

If Bank of America was the only credit card issuer available, you could still find a card that fits your purchasing and earning preferences. There is, however, an endless variety of cards available in the marketplace for consumers and businesses.

You should use the CardMatch tool to see if there are any credit card offers that have been matched to your profile, or use our complete guide to finding personal prequalified and pre-approved offers from credit card issuers to see your existing offers.

Narrowing the selection of cards that fit your situation is essential to select a credit card that maximizes the benefits, earnings, and rewards you ultimately receive on the card.

0.title: Why Bank of America Corporation (BAC) Crashed on Tuesday
0.snippet: We recently compiled a list of the 10 Stocks Bear the Brunt of Trade Threats. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Bank of America...
0.content:
We recently compiled a list of the 10 Stocks Bear the Brunt of Trade Threats. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Bank of America Corporation (NYSE:BAC) stands against the other stocks.

Wall Street’s main indices fell further on Tuesday as investors sold off positions to mitigate risks from the ongoing trade tensions among some of the world’s largest economies.

The Dow Jones fell the most during the trading session, losing 1.55 percent, while the S&P 500 declined 1.22 percent. The Nasdaq dropped by 0.35 percent.

Following the US imposition of a 25-percent tax on goods from Canada and Mexico on Tuesday, countries announced a promise to retaliate. Canada, as well as China, which received a 10 percent additional tax, immediately announced retaliation. Mexico is expected to follow suit.

The negative sentiment spilled over to 10 stocks, predominantly retailers, with the tariff threats seen to pose pressures on their profit margins. In this article, we have detailed the reasons behind their declines.

To come up with Tuesday’s worst performers, we considered only the stocks with $2 billion in market capitalization and $5 million in daily trading volume.

Is Bank of America Corporation (BAC) the Best Dividend Stock to Buy According to Billionaires?

A professional banker providing consultation to a customer in the security of his office.

Bank of America Corporation (NYSE:BAC)

Bank of America Corporation (NYSE:BAC) dropped its share prices by 6.34 percent on Tuesday—a second straight day—as investor sentiment was weighed down by its potential risks from the growing trade tensions between the US and its largest trading partners.

Bank of America Corporation (NYSE:BAC) traded in line with its counterparts on Tuesday, albeit it posted the largest losses among its peers.

With the economies throwing tariff retaliations, investors moved to park funds for now to mitigate risks. With Bank of America Corporation (NYSE:BAC) set to release its next earnings results in April next month, investors will be looking out for any cues on its provisions for credit losses, which could go higher with higher taxes now in place.

PCLs are funds that money lenders keep and are treated as their own expense to absorb delinquent debts that can no longer be recovered.

Overall BAC ranks 10th on our list of Tuesday's worst performers. While we acknowledge the potential of BAC as an investment, our conviction lies in the belief that some AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and doing so within a shorter time frame. If you are looking for an AI stock that is more promising than BAC but trades at less than 5 times its earnings, check out our report about the cheapest AI stock.

How To Qualify for a Bank of America New Account Bonus

To qualify for Bank of America’s promotions, start by choosing the account that fits your needs, as bonuses are often tied to specific products.

Many bonuses are only available to those who open the account through a specific webpage, so make sure you open the account from the correct page. Enter your information and apply for the account.

For most checking and business accounts, you’ll need to make a minimum opening deposit and set up direct deposits that meet the bank’s requirements.

Note that bonuses are available for new bank accounts only, and existing customers may not qualify if they already hold the same type of account. Keep an eye on the fine print for each promotion to ensure you meet all conditions to receive your bonus.

Comparing Bank of America Offers to Competitor Promotions

Bank of America offers competitive promotions — though its bonuses aren’t the highest you’ll find, they’re far from the lowest. And with the same bonus for multiple accounts, most people will be able to find an account that’s right for them without missing out on any extra cash. Also, some of the minimum opening deposits are low compared to other banks.

Bank of America also offers a wide network of branches and ATMs, making it easily accessible to most.

In addition, Bank of America’s Preferred Rewards program offers four reward tiers with perks such as waived account maintenance fees, better loan rates and higher annual percentage yields on qualifying savings accounts.

Tips for Maximizing Your Bank of America Offer

To make sure you get the most out of your bonus, here are a few tips:

Read the terms and conditions carefully to make sure you meet all the requirements.

Only open an account if you’re sure you’ll be able to meet the requirements to waive the monthly maintenance fee.

Keep track of your balance to avoid other fees, like overdraft fees, that could eat up part of your bonus.

And if you’re not ready to open an account right now, check the Bank of America website — and the websites of any other banks you’re considering — to compare current promotions when you are ready to open a new account.

Conclusion

Bank of America is currently offering a $300 bonus for new personal checking accounts and a $200 bonus for new business checking accounts, provided you meet the requirements. With a variety of accounts to choose from, anyone should be able to find the right checking account for their needs.

Bank of America offers a full lineup of banking products and services with branches across the country. It may be worth checking out if you like the convenience offered by a large, national bank.

Cash bonuses are great perks, but they shouldn’t be the only reason you choose a bank. Make sure it meets your needs and explore the bank’s other offerings, including savings accounts and CD accounts, before opening an account.

FAQs Here's more about Bank of America promotions. How long does it take to receive a new account bonus? You should receive your Bank of America checking account bonus within 60 days of meeting all the requirements to earn it.

Can existing customers qualify for these promotions? No, Bank of America’s current promotions are for new customers. If you’ve owned or co-owned a Bank of America checking account within the last 12 months, you aren’t eligible for a bonus.

What happens if I close my account early? If you close your account before you’ve received your bonus, you will no longer be eligible for the bonus.

Are there any taxes on bank bonuses? Yes, bank bonuses are considered taxable income. You’ll need to fill out Form 1099 when filing your taxes.

3.title: Making the Most of the Bank of America Travel Rewards
3.snippet: The Bank of America® Travel Rewards credit card offers several ways to maximize your rewards — including earning double points when you book travel through...
3.content:
NerdWallet rating NerdWallet's ratings are determined by our editorial team. The scoring formula incorporates coverage options, customer experience, customizability, cost and more. Learn More

The Bank of America® Travel Rewards credit card offers several ways to maximize your rewards — including earning double points when you book travel through the Bank of America® Travel Center. But the most significant boost comes from having one or more investment accounts with Merrill. And the more money you have in those accounts, the bigger your rewards.

Here's how to make the most of the Bank of America® Travel Rewards credit card.

Get the loyalty bonus

With the Bank of America® Travel Rewards credit card, everyone gets 1.5 points for every $1 spent on most purchases. Enroll in the Bank of America Preferred Rewards® program, and the bonuses increase to 25%, 50% or 75%, depending on your combined balances at Bank of America® and Merrill:

Program tier Required balance Relationship bonus Gold $20,000 to $49,999. 25%. Platinum $50,000 to $99,999. 50%. Platinum Honors $100,000 to $999,999. 75%. Diamond $1,000,000 to $9,999,999. 75%. Diamond Honors $10 million or more. 75%.

Say you spend $1,000 a month on the card, or $12,000 a year. At 1.5 points per dollar, you'd earn $180 in rewards. Bonuses really start to climb when you have Preferred Rewards status:

Preferred Rewards level Rewards boost Points per $1 spent Annual points ($12,000 in spending) None — 1.5 18,000 Gold 25% 1.875 22,500 Platinum 50% 2.25 27,000 Platinum Honors, Diamond or Diamond Honors 75% 2.625 31,500

Getting the loyalty bonus is a simple way to boost your rewards, but, of course, simple isn't the same as easy. Having $20,000, $50,000 or $100,000 in combined accounts is easy to say, hard to do.

Use the Travel Center

The Bank of America® Travel Rewards credit card boosts your rewards to 3 points per $1 spent on travel booked through the Bank of America® Travel Center. That includes flights, hotel nights, rental cars — everything except insurance. There's no limit on the extra points you can earn this way.

The card also comes with a solid sign-up promotion, so make sure you spend enough to qualify for it: 25,000 online bonus points after you make at least $1,000 in purchases in the first 90 days of account opening - that can be a $250 statement credit toward travel purchases.. Other travel cards offer bigger sign-up bonuses, but those cards typically come with an annual fee. You can't beat the Bank of America® Travel Rewards credit card's annual fee of $0. Like most travel credit cards, this card doesn't charge a foreign transaction fee.

Take an interest rate break

New cardholders get an interest rate break: 0% Intro APR for 15 billing cycles for purchases, and for any balance transfers made in the first 60 days. After the Intro APR offer ends, a Variable APR that’s currently 18.24%-28.24% will apply. You'll be able to rack up points without worrying about the interest piling up, too.

You should be aware, though, that balance transfers will incur a fee: 3% for 60 days from account opening, then 4%.

How to redeem rewards on the Bank of America® Travel Rewards credit card

It's just as easy to redeem points as it is to earn them. Simply make a restaurant or travel-related purchase with your card, then redeem your points for statement credit to offset the purchase. Points are worth 1 cent apiece when redeemed for travel. And when you think "travel" purchases, think outside the box. The Bank of America® Travel Rewards credit card's definition of travel is wider than many other cards', including amusement parks, art galleries, circuses, aquariums, zoos and many other things as travel expenses.

The ability to redeem for credit against restaurant and travel purchases offers tremendous flexibility. You can book travel any way you want, fly on any airline, stay at any hotel. There are no blackout dates or restrictions.

You can also redeem points for gift cards or to make a cash deposit into one of your Bank of America®, Merrill Edge® or Merrill Lynch accounts®, but you'll get a much lower redemption value per point. Still, with the bonus percentages, you can earn almost as much as a card that pays a higher reward rate.

Pay more, earn more

A key element of the Bank of America® Travel Rewards credit card's appeal is the $0 annual fee. If you're willing to pay an annual fee, you can get a higher rewards rate even without loyalty bonuses. Take the Capital One Venture Rewards Credit Card. Here's what it offers:

Annual fee: $95.

Sign-up bonus: Enjoy $250 to use on Capital One Travel in your first cardholder year, plus earn 75,000 bonus miles once you spend $4,000 on purchases within the first 3 months from account opening - that’s equal to $1,000 in travel.

APR: The ongoing APR is 19.99%-29.24% Variable APR.

Rewards: Earn 2 miles for every $1 spent with no limit on how much you can earn. Miles can be redeemed for travel and restaurant purchases at a rate of 1 cent per point.
